# exceptionHandler(_:shouldLogException:mask:)

**Instance Method**

Implemented by the delegate to evaluate whether the delegating exception hangler should log a given exception.

## Declaration

```swift
func exceptionHandler(_ sender: NSExceptionHandler!, shouldLogException exception: NSException!, mask aMask: Int) -> Bool
```

## Parameters

- **sender**: The [doc://com.apple.documentation/documentation/ExceptionHandling/NSExceptionHandler] object sending the message.
- **exception**: An [doc://com.apple.documentation/documentation/Foundation/NSException] object describing the exception to be evaluated.
- **aMask**: The bit mask indicating the types of exceptions logged by the [doc://com.apple.documentation/documentation/ExceptionHandling/NSExceptionHandler] object. See Logging and Handling Constants and System Hang Constants for descriptions of the possible `enum` constants.

## Return Value

[doc://com.apple.objectivec/documentation/ObjectiveC/YES] to have the [doc://com.apple.documentation/documentation/ExceptionHandling/NSExceptionHandler] object log the exception, [doc://com.apple.objectivec/documentation/ObjectiveC/NO] otherwise.
